title: Can't see descriptions on hover
body:
Nothing happens when I hover over items with descriptions.

I've tried disabling all my css snippets, but nothing happens.

I'm using the minimal theme by Kepano
author: blackpeasy

comments.body:
Hmm, hard to debug without more info

Can you share the chronos code block you are using?

Just the example one

```chronos
- [2024-02-26~2024-03-10] Tournament
* [2024-02-26] Game 1 | Austin
* [2024-02-28] Game 2 | Los Angeles
* [2024-03-06] Game 3 | Tokyo
* [2024-03-10] Game 4 | Jakarta
```
Found the source! Had the "Hider" plugin enabled with 'hide all tooltips'. Didn't know that was what you had used to create the pop ups

ah ha! Interesting - the Chronos plugin used Obsidian's baked-in tooltip API. Seems like however that is implemented falls under the Hider plugin's jurisdiction :) 

Glad it's solved!

title: Add Dynamic Timeline Support with Dataview Integration
body:
# Add Dynamic Timeline Support with Dataview Integration

## Overview
Added documentation and examples for creating dynamic timelines using Dataview integration. This allows users to automatically generate and update timelines from their note metadata without manual maintenance.

## Changes
- Added new "Dynamic Timelines" section to README

## Testing
- Verified examples work with latest versions of:
  - Chronos Timeline v1.0.0
  - Dataview v0.5.67
author: Marlon154

comments.body: Thank you so much for taking the time to contribute this! I'm sure others will find it useful (myself included)
Happy to hear it! I thought this is an important feature, but there is no need to reinvent it when Dataview provides a good solution.

title: Cheetsheet update
body:
I'm getting quite a few parsing fails in the cheetsheet now.  

Also, I have seen reference to a "compact" timeline mode elsewhere, but don't find it referenced in the cheetsheet.
author: Rick-Kennerly

comments.body: @Rick-Kennerly thanks for raising. Which version of Chronos are you using? All the cheatsheet blocks are working on my machine ™️ so I'd love to see screenshots of the errors if you still have them!
@Rick-Kennerly also, I'm not familiar with "compact mode" - where did you see this?

I'll see.  Probably not.
